physDesc.p: This letter is two pages long. On the first page, the words “Poetry Monroe” are written in pencil at the top.

encodingDesc.p: This letter contains references to the following:

div.p: I am sending you 10 copies of the June number of “The Egoist,” in hopes that you may persuade McClurg to take them, since he had ten copies of the May number.

I wish the spirit would move you to answer in “Poetry” Conrad Aiken’s violent diatribe against us in the July “Poetry Journal.” The poor, little “Poetry Journal” is trying to bring itself up to date very hard. It asked me for contributions, as you see by their announcing a poem of mine for August; and it has also asked me to write a short article explaining our views for the nine hundredth time.

I suppose I could answer Aiken myself, but I do not want to let him draw me like that; and if you could see your way to putting in a short comment over your own or Alice Henderson’s signature, on the general pigheadedness and reactionary quality of this article, I should be eternally
grateful. I am having them send you a copy so you can see it. We do have a hard time. It is all up-hill work for all of us, which is the chief reason it is ridiculous to quarrel among ourselves. Nobody objects to it so much as I, and I wish Ezra had not such a passion for it. If you do not want to do this, of course don’t but it would be fine if you would.
Have you found out whether McClurg sold any of those ten numbers he took, for he has not sent me any money?
